estimateFee(bytes,bytes).details: The estimated fees are the minimum required; it's recommended to increase the fees amount when sending a message. The unused amount will be refunded

params.adapterParams: The params used to specify the custom amount of gas required for the execution on the destination
params.payload: The payload to be sent to the remote chain. It's computed as follows: payload = abi.encode(delegatee, checkpoint, votes)

returns._0: nativeFee The amount of fee in the native gas token (e.g. ETH)
returns._1: zroFee The amount of fee in ZRO token

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

removeTrustedRemote().custom:event: Emit TrustedRemoteRemoved with remote chain Id.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

retrySyncVotes(uint256,bytes,bytes,uint2.custom:event: Emits ClearPayload with votesSynced and hash
retrySyncVotes(uint256,bytes,bytes,uint2.details: Allows providing more fees if needed. The extra fees will be refunded to the caller

params.adapterParams: The params used to specify the custom amount of gas required for the execution on the Binance chain
params.originalValue: The msg.value passed when syncVotes function was called
params.payload: The payload to be sent to the remote chain. It's computed as follows: payload = abi.encode(delegatee, checkpoint, votes)
params.votesSynced: Number of votes synced to identify a failed message

setTrustedRemoteAddress(bytes).custom:event: Emits SetTrustedRemoteAddress with remote chain Id and remote address

params.remoteAddress: The address of the contract on the remote chain to receive messages sent by this contract

syncVotes(bytes,bytes).custom:event: Emit ExecuteSyncVotes on success and StorePayload on failure

params.adapterParams: The params used to specify the custom amount of gas required for the execution on the destination
params.payload: The payload to be sent to the remote chain. It's computed as follows: payload = abi.encode(delegatee, checkpoint, votes)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

ZeroAddressNotAllowed().notice: Thrown if the supplied address is a zero address where it is not allowed

ClearPayload(uint256,bytes32).notice: Emitted when votes synced on retry

ExecuteSyncVotes(uint16,bytes,bytes).notice: Emitted when votes synced on BSC chain successfully

SetTrustedRemoteAddress(uint16,bytes).notice: Emitted when a remote message receiver is set for the remote chain

StorePayload(uint256,uint16,bytes,bytes,.notice: Emitted when an execution hash of a failed message is saved

TrustedRemoteRemoved(uint16).notice: Emitted when trusted remote sets to empty.

LZ_ENDPOINT().notice: LayerZero endpoint for sending messages to remote chains

estimateFee(bytes,bytes).notice: Estimates LayerZero fees for cross-chain message delivery to the remote chain

setTrustedRemoteAddress(bytes).notice: Sets the remote message receiver address

syncVotes(bytes,bytes).notice: Sync votes of user on Binance chain

trustedRemoteLookup(uint16).notice: Specifies the allowed path for sending messages (remote chainId => remote app address + local app address)

userdoc.notice: The VotesSyncSender send voting information of user from remote chains(non-BSC chains) to Binance chain with the help of layer zero bridge. It sends voting information of user from XVSVaultDest to receiver contract on Binance chain in the form of encoded data known as payload.
